title: Create Notice with Valid Inputs
description: Verify that a new notice can be successfully created when all required fields are provided with valid data and the notice is submitted for approval.

steps.description: Navigate to the Write Notice page.
Fill in the form with valid title, content, type, importance, recipients, and scheduled dispatch time.
Submit the form.
Verify that the notice is saved with status PENDING and a confirmation message is displayed.

title: Notice Creation with Missing Required Fields
description: Verify that the notice creation form enforces validation by not allowing submission when required fields are missing.

steps.description: Navigate to the Write Notice page.
Omit filling one or more required fields such as title or recipients.
Attempt to submit the form.
Verify that the form prevents submission and displays appropriate validation error messages.

title: View Notices in Dashboard with Correct Information
description: Verify that the Dashboard correctly displays a list of notices with accurate titles, statuses, dates, writers, and statistics upon loading.

steps.description: Navigate to the Dashboard page.
Verify that notices are listed showing correct title, status badges, date, and writer information.
Verify that statistical charts reflect accurate data from the notice records.

title: Manager Approves Pending Notice
description: Verify that a manager with appropriate permissions can approve a notice that is in PENDING status.

steps.description: Login as a manager with approval permissions.
Navigate to the Notice Detail & Approval page for a notice with PENDING status.
Verify that Approve and Reject buttons are visible.
Click the Approve button.
Verify that the notice status changes from PENDING to APPROVED and a success message is shown.

title: Manager Rejects Pending Notice
description: Verify that a manager can reject a notice that is in PENDING status and the status updates appropriately.

steps.description: Login as a manager with approval permissions.
Open the Notice Detail & Approval page for a PENDING notice.
Click the Reject button.
Verify that the notice status is updated to REJECTED and the user is notified.

title: Non-manager User Cannot See Approve or Reject Buttons
description: Verify that users without manager role or approval permissions do not see approval controls on PENDING notices.

steps.description: Login as a regular user without managerial approval permissions.
Open the Notice Detail page for a notice with PENDING status.
Verify that the Approve and Reject buttons are not visible.

title: Approved Notice Creates Outlook Calendar Event
description: Verify that upon approval of a notice, an event is registered in the Outlook 'IT Notice Schedule' calendar through MS Graph API.

steps.description: Approve a notice.
Verify that the system calls MS Graph API to create a calendar event linked to the approved notice.
Verify in Outlook calendar that the event exists with correct title, scheduled time, and other details.

title: Multi-channel Notifications Are Dispatched on Approval
description: Verify that after notice approval, notifications are sent correctly through all configured channels: email, company messenger (GW), portal, and KZ mobile app.

steps.description: Approve a notice selecting all notification channels.
Verify that an email notification is received by all recipients.
Verify that a message is sent via company messenger (GW).
Verify that portal notifications appear for recipients.
Verify that push notifications are received on the KZ mobile app.

title: Dashboard Reflects Correct Notice Counts and Statuses
description: Verify that the Dashboard correctly updates and displays counts of notices segmented by approval and dispatch status after changes in notices.

steps.description: Create, approve, reject, and dispatch notices to create varied states.
Refresh or reload the Dashboard page.
Verify that counts for pending, approved, rejected, dispatched, and completed notices are accurate and updated.

title: History Log Captures Approval and Dispatch Events
description: Verify that all approval actions and dispatch events are logged accurately and that logs can be searched and filtered by criteria such as user, date, and notice type.

steps.description: Approve, reject, and dispatch multiple notices.
Navigate to the History page.
Perform searches and apply filters on approval logs and dispatch history.
Verify that relevant log entries appear correctly with accurate details.

title: Completion Notice Updates Outlook Calendar and Notifies Recipients
description: Verify that registering a completion notice updates the corresponding Outlook calendar event visually and sends notifications to all relevant recipients.

steps.description: Register a completion notice for an approved and dispatched notice.
Verify that the Outlook event’s visual state is updated accordingly.
Verify that notifications about completion are sent through all relevant channels.

title: Responsive UI Displays Properly on Mobile and Desktop Devices
description: Verify that the web interface layout and elements render correctly and remain functional on different screen sizes and device types including desktop and mobile browsers.

steps.description: Open the application in desktop web browsers of various resolutions.
Verify that all pages (Dashboard, Write Notice, Notice Detail & Approval, History) render without layout issues and all UI elements are accessible.
Open the application on mobile devices or emulators with varying dimensions.
Verify that responsive UI adapts properly with no content overflow or usability impairments.

title: User Access via SSO Without Separate Login
description: Verify that users accessing the system through SSO gain entry without requiring a separate login and that permission enforcement works to restrict notice approval controls to authorized users only.

steps.description: Access the system with SSO credentials.
Verify the user accesses the dashboard directly without an additional login prompt.
Attempt to access approval functionality based on user’s role.
Verify that approval controls are visible only to manager users and other users do not have access.

title: Notice Filtering by Type, Service, Department, Recipients, and Hashtag
description: Verify that filtering notices on the Dashboard and History pages by notice type, affected service, sender department, recipient, and hashtags works correctly to narrow the displayed results.

steps.description: Navigate to the Dashboard page.
Select filters for notice type, affected service, sender department, recipients, and hashtags individually and in combination.
Verify that the listed notices update accordingly and only matching results are displayed.

title: Scheduled Dispatch Executes at Correct Time
description: Verify that notices scheduled for future dispatch are sent out at the specified scheduled time and not before.

steps.description: Create and approve a notice with a scheduled dispatch time set in the near future.
Verify that notification channels do not dispatch before the scheduled time.
Verify that dispatch occurs promptly at the scheduled time.

title: Invalid MS Graph API Responses Handled Gracefully
description: Verify that if the external Outlook calendar event registration via MS Graph API fails or returns errors, the system handles these gracefully by notifying the user/admin and retrying or logging the error.

steps.description: Simulate MS Graph API failure during calendar event creation.
Verify that the system displays an error message or logs the failure appropriately.
Verify that the notice remains in an appropriate state allowing retry or manual intervention.

title: Notice Detail Page Shows Accurate Information
description: Verify that the Notice Detail page shows all notice details correctly, including status, writer, date, approval logs, and dispatch history.

steps.description: Navigate to the Notice Detail page for a given notice.
Verify that all fields like title, content, type, importance, recipients, scheduled dispatch time, and status are displayed accurately.
Verify that approval logs and dispatch history related to the notice are visible and complete.
